title: What it’s like to work in a Michelin restaurant, according to Boston chefs
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food Ahead of the Boston's Michelin Guide debut, local chefs share their experiences working in Michelin kitchens: "It was like the military in some ways.
" Tracy Chang of Pagu is one of many chefs in Boston who cut their teeth at a Michelin star restaurant.
John Tlumacki/Globe Staff ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Rhode Island mom held at Logan for 13 days likely heading to Maine ICE facility
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Eva Mendes's lawyer says the federal government is giving him the "runaround" as he seeks information about her "unconscionable" detainment.
Inside Logan International Airport.
Joseph Prezioso/AFP via Getty Images A Rhode Island mother who has been held at Logan Airport for almost two weeks will likely be transferred to an ICE facility in Maine in the coming days.

title: Lindsay Clancy murder trial pushed back to July 2026
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Judge William Sullivan denied a defense request to move Clancy’s trial to Suffolk County in light of the intense media coverage.
Lindsay Clancy appeared via Zoom from Tewksbury Hospital for a hearing last month in Plymouth Superior Court in Brockton.
Clancy has pleaded not guilty to three counts of murder for the slayings of her three young children.

title: Red Sox seen as ‘strongest contender’ to sign Pete Alonso away from Mets
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "Either they bring back Bregman, or they make an all-out pursuit for Pete Alonso.

title: Bail set for N.H. man in Peabody rape cold case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Prosecutors allege Darrell Lavoie blindfolded and raped a woman at knifepoint 34 years ago.
By Abby Patkin November 18, 2025 | 10:11 AM 1 minute to read A New Hampshire man was held on $100,000 bail Monday as he faces charges in a 1991 rape cold case out of Peabody.
Darrell Lavoie, 59, of Nashua, pleaded not guilty in September to charges of aggravated rape, rape, assault with a dangerous weapon, and breaking and entering, court records show.
